title: Prophecy Fraud Case Delayed to Review Classified Documents
description: The criminal fraud trial against Prophecy Asset Management co-owner Jeffrey Spotts over $300 million in investor losses has been delayed until at least May while a judge considers how to handle as many as 20 classified documents that touch on the case in some way.
content: The criminal fraud trial against Prophecy Asset Management co-owner Jeffrey Spotts over $300 million in investor losses has been delayed until at least May while a judge considers how to handle as many as 20 classified documents that touch on the case in some way.
